alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 5:24AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW LIKELY SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY... A complex area of low pressure moving toward the region from the Gulf of Alaska will bring accumulating snow to the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska Valley tonight into Sunday. While there may be some periods of flurries or light snowfall today, the accumulating snow should begin this evening with heaviest rates occurring late Saturday night through Sunday morning. Although there is still uncertainty in the exact track and timing of this system, 3 to 4 inches of snow is likely for most locations with locally higher amounts possible along the Anchorage Hillside and the Glenn and Seward Highways. Visibility may also be reduced at times Sunday morning due to increasing northwesterly winds. Strongest winds are expected in West Anchorage and through Turnagain Arm. For the latest forecast, visit www.weather.gov/afc
